hints.content:
The area is the number of $1 \times 1$ squares the shape covers.

 Let's count the number of squares covered in each shape to find which shape has an area of $12$ square units.

[[☃ image 1]]

This shape has an area of $11$ square units, not $12$ square units.

options.alt:
A shape with 8 sides made up of 11 squares is drawn on a grid. The length of each side is as follows, beginning at the top in a clockwise pattern, 4 squares to the right, 2 squares down, 2 squares to the left, 1 square down, 1 square to the left, 1 square down, 1 square to the left, 4 squares up. 

Each square is numbered inside the shape counting from 1 to 11. !

hints.content:
[[☃ image 1]]

This shape has an area of $10$ square units, not $12$ square units.

options.alt:
A shape with 8 sides is made up of 10 squares is drawn on a grid. The length of each side is as follows, beginning at the top in a clockwise pattern, 2 squares to the right, 3 squares down, 1 square to the left, 3 squares down, 2 squares to the left, 1 square up, 1 square to the right, 5 squares up.

Each square inside the shape is counted from 1 to 10. !

hints.content:
[[☃ image 1]]

This shape has an area of $12$ square units.

options.alt:
A shape with 4 sides is made up of 12 squares drawn on a grid. The length of each side is as follows, beginning at the top in a clockwise pattern, 6 squares to the right, 2 squares down, 6 squares to the left, 2 squares up.

Each square inside the shape is counted from 1 to 12. !

question.content:
**Which shape below has an area of $12$ square units?**


[[☃ image 1]]

 is $1$ square unit.

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A square is equal to one square unit. !
